data.title: Furlongs per Fortnight
data.statement:
<<Background:>>
Most of the world uses the "metric system" but the United States still uses the "imperial system" which has all sorts of interesting units of distance (some more common than others)

Speed is simply some-distance per some-time


<<Your task:>>
This puzzle inputs a [[inputSpeed]] expressed in [[dist1]](unit of distance) per [[time1]](unit of time)

Your challenge is to convert that to another [[dist2]](unit of distance) per [[time2]](unit of time)

Units of distance:
◆ 1 mile = 8 furlongs
◆ 1 furlong = 10 chains
◆ 1 chain = 22 yards
◆ 1 yard = 3 feet
◆ 1 foot = 12 inches

Units of time:
◆ 1 fortnight = 2 weeks
◆ 1 week = 7 days
◆ 1 day = 24 hours
◆ 1 hour = 60 minutes
◆ 1 minute = 60 seconds


In a speed expression:
~ a <<distance>> uses its <<plural>> version, such as yards, feet, inches (except for the rare occasion when the speed is exactly 1, which this puzzle doesn't include)
~ a <<time>> uses its <<singular>> version, such as hour, minute




Sources:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FFF_system
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Imperial_units

testCases.title: DT -> dt - Test 1
testCases.testIn: 790 furlongs per fortnight CONVERT TO chains per week

testCases.title: Validator 1
testCases.testIn: 538 yards per week CONVERT TO inches per day

testCases.title: D -> d - Test 2
testCases.testIn: 430 miles per day CONVERT TO feet per day

testCases.title: Validator 2
testCases.testIn: 683 chains per fortnight CONVERT TO feet per fortnight

testCases.testIn: 427 furlongs per week CONVERT TO feet per fortnight

testCases.title: Validator 3
testCases.testIn: 681 chains per second CONVERT TO yards per hour

testCases.title: dT -> Dt - Test 4
testCases.testIn: 938 feet per day CONVERT TO chains per hour

testCases.title: Validator 4
testCases.testIn: 857 furlongs per fortnight CONVERT TO miles per day

testCases.title: d -> D - Test 5
testCases.testIn: 461 feet per hour CONVERT TO chains per hour

testCases.title: Validator 5
testCases.testIn: 727 yards per week CONVERT TO chains per week

testCases.title: dt -> DT - Test 6
testCases.testIn: 965 inches per second CONVERT TO furlongs per minute

testCases.title: Validator 6
testCases.testIn: 947 furlongs per second CONVERT TO miles per week

testCases.title: T -> t - Test 7
testCases.testIn: 628 yards per week CONVERT TO yards per minute

testCases.title: Validator 7
testCases.testIn: 991 yards per minute CONVERT TO yards per second

testCases.title: t -> T - Test 8
testCases.testIn: 135 miles per minute CONVERT TO miles per day

testCases.title: Validator 8
testCases.testIn: 350 miles per second CONVERT TO miles per fortnight

testCases.title: miles to inches - Test 9
testCases.testIn: 509 miles per week CONVERT TO inches per second

testCases.title: Validator 9
testCases.testIn: 152 miles per day CONVERT TO inches per minute

testCases.title: inches to miles - Test 10
testCases.testIn: 142 inches per second CONVERT TO miles per week

testCases.title: Validator 10
testCases.testIn: 962 inches per minute CONVERT TO miles per hour

testCases.title: fortnights to seconds - Test 11
testCases.testIn: 334 furlongs per fortnight CONVERT TO inches per second

testCases.title: Validator 11
testCases.testIn: 891 chains per fortnight CONVERT TO inches per second

testCases.title: seconds to fortnights - Test 12
testCases.testIn: 709 inches per second CONVERT TO chains per fortnight

testCases.title: Validator 12
testCases.testIn: 915 yards per second CONVERT TO miles per fortnight

testCases.title: Extreme1 - Test 13
testCases.testIn: 242 inches per second CONVERT TO miles per fortnight

testCases.title: Validator 13
testCases.testIn: 993 inches per second CONVERT TO miles per fortnight

testCases.title: Extreme2 - Test 14
testCases.testIn: 672 miles per fortnight CONVERT TO inches per second

testCases.title: Validator 14
testCases.testIn: 480 miles per fortnight CONVERT TO inches per second

data.stubGenerator:
read aSpeed:string(256)
write The Converted Speed
data.inputDescription:
A string: [[inputSpeed]] [[dist1]] {{per}} [[time1]] {{CONVERT TO}} [[dist2]] {{per}} [[time2]]
where [[inputSpeed]] is an integer and the rest are strings
data.outputDescription:
A string: [[convertedSpeed]] [[dist2]] {{per}} [[time2]]
where [[convertedSpeed]] is a float rounded to nearest 1/10

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Background:
Most of the world uses the "metric system" but the United States still uses the "imperial system" which has all sorts of interesting units of distance (some more common than others)

Speed is simply some-distance per some-time


Your task:
This puzzle inputs a inputSpeed expressed in dist1(unit of distance) per time1(unit of time)

Your challenge is to convert that to another dist2(unit of distance) per time2(unit of time)

Units of distance:
◆ 1 mile = 8 furlongs
◆ 1 furlong = 10 chains
◆ 1 chain = 22 yards
◆ 1 yard = 3 feet
◆ 1 foot = 12 inches

Units of time:
◆ 1 fortnight = 2 weeks
◆ 1 week = 7 days
◆ 1 day = 24 hours
◆ 1 hour = 60 minutes
◆ 1 minute = 60 seconds


In a speed expression:
~ a distance uses its plural version, such as yards, feet, inches (except for the rare occasion when the speed is exactly 1, which this puzzle doesn't include)
~ a time uses its singular version, such as hour, minute




Sources:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FFF_system
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Imperial_units
Input
A string: inputSpeed dist1 per time1 CONVERT TO dist2 per time2
where inputSpeed is an integer and the rest are strings
Output
A string: convertedSpeed dist2 per time2
where convertedSpeed is a float rounded to nearest 1/10
Constraints
Example
Input
790 furlongs per fortnight CONVERT TO chains per week
Output
3950.0 chains per week
